content.text:
# 1871 New England colonial by-election

A by-election for the seat of New England in the New South Wales Legislative Assembly was held on 6 January 1871 because of the resignation of Charles Weaver to accept appointment as a police magistrate at Gosford.
Dates
{| class="wikitable"
! Date !! Event
|-
| 18 Jul 1871
| Charles Weaver resigned.
|-
| 29 July 1871
| Writ of election issued by the Speaker of the Legislative Assembly.
|-
| 1 August 1871
| Charles Weaver appointed as a police magistrate.
|-
| 21 August 1871
| Nominations at Armidale
|-
| 28 August 1871
| Polling day
|-
| 2 October 1871
| Return of writ
|}
Result
}}
Charles Weaver resigned.
